attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the configuration whether the chart should appear in an animated fashion. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control whether empty datasets in your data will be connected to each other OR will they appear as broken data sets?
attrs.name: connectNullData

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description:
Sets whether the `clickURL` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when the chart is clicked) overrides the `link` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when a data plot is clicked). 

Default value: 0 (`clickURL` does not override `link`)
attrs.name: clickURLOverridesPlotLinks

attrs.description: Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: If you want your own palette derived from a particular hex color, you can specify the same here. All other colors on the chart will automatically derive from that palette.
attrs.name: paletteThemeColor

attrs.description: The `palette` attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of dataplots (i.e., column, line, area etc.). The `paletteThemeColor` attribute allows to specify your own palette derived from a particular hex color that is applied to chart background, canvas, font, tool-tips and also dataplots. Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the dataplots only. The list of colors have to be separated by comma e.g., `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
attrs.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma
attrs.name: paletteColors

attrs.description: Whether to show the real-time update related menu items (like Start/Stop Update or Clear Chart) in chart's context menu? Note: For JavaScript charts real-time update related menu items do not appear by default. You need to explicitly set `'showRTMenuItem': '1'` in the `chart` object. The menu appears as a button on the bottom-left corner of the JavaScript chart. You can then use the button to Start/Stop Update or Clear chart.
attrs.name: showRTMenuItem

attrs.description: Whether to show "Print Chart" item in the context menu of the chart? Even if you opt to hide the item in context menu, you can still opt to invoke `print()` JavaScript method of the chart to print the same.
attrs.name: showPrintMenuItem

attrs.description: By default, the real-time charts wait for a few seconds after rendering for the first time and before updating itself with new data. To allow the chart to start updating itself as soon as it is rendered, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: refreshInstantly

attrs.description: Setting this attribute to 1 helps in depicting the values in percentage figures. When this attribute is set to 1 the chart considers the total of the stacked dataplot as 100% and the Y-Axis shows a scale from 0% to 100%.
attrs.name: stack100Percent

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage figures in data values of the chart.
attrs.name: showPercentValues

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage figures in tooltip.
attrs.name: showPercentInToolTip

attrs.description: Setting this attribute to 1, you can allow the chart to automatically resize itself when the parent container of the chart is resized.
attrs.name: manageResize

attrs.description: When enabled in AUTO mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.
attrs.name: useEllipsesWhenOverflow

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a transparency for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a scale for magnifying all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when a chart begins to load. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: loadMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when the specified chart type is not supported. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when chart data begins loading. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if the data loaded for a chart is empty. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if the data to be loaded for the chart is invalid. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessage

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageScale

attrs.description:
Determines how the data index will be assigned to data plots in real-time charts. For `“variableIndex”: “1”`, a variable index is assigned to each of the chart container slots, and is updated every time a new data plot comes into the container. Therefore, a data plot retains the index assigned to it at the time of creation throughout its lifetime. When `“variableIndex”: “0”`, a fixed index is assigned to each of the chart container slots. Therefore, the index of a data plot changes every time the data plot changes its position. 

Default value for this attribute is __1__.
attrs.name: variableIndex

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: X-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisName

attrs.description: Y-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: yAxisName

attrs.description: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you've the special characters (UTF-8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
attrs.name: rotateYAxisName

attrs.description: If you opt to not rotate y-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to y-axis name.
attrs.name: yAxisNameWidth

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption, x-axis and y-axis names etc.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font color
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis font size
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be bold
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be italicized
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis alpha including font and background
attrs.name: xAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis background alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border padding
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border radius
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border thickness
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description: Whether the x-axis border should be rendered using dashed lines
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of x-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font family for the text
attrs.name: yAxisNameFont

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font color
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the y-axis (primary / secondary) font size
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be bold
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be italicized
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) alpha including font and background
attrs.name: yAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) background alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border padding
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border radius
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border thickness
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) border should be rendered using dashed lines
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of y-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMaxValue

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMinValue

attrs.description: The y-axis of the charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not. The values of `showLimits` and `showDivLineValues`, if specified explicitly, overrides the value of this attribute.
attrs.name: showYAxisValues

attrs.description: Whether to show chart limit values. If not specified `showYAxisValues` attribute overrides this value.
attrs.name: showLimits

attrs.description: Whether to show div line values. If not specified `showYAxisValues` attribute overrides this value.
attrs.name: showDivLineValues

attrs.description: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesStep

attrs.description: Decimal places for y-axis values.
attrs.name: yAxisValueDecimals

attrs.description: Whether to force decimal places for y-axis values.
attrs.name: forceYAxisDecimals

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various properties of the Y-Axis.

attrs.description: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: This attribute can be used to set the maximum height for the x-axis labels (data labels) excluding the x-axis title. If any label goes beyond this height, the label will be truncated. In stagger mode, the number of stagger lines will be reduced if they exceed this value.
attrs.name: maxLabelHeight

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you can control how your data labels (x-axis labels) will appear on the chart. There are 4 options: WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. WRAP wraps the label text if it's longer than the allotted area. ROTATE rotates the label in vertical or slanted position. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.
attrs.name: labelDisplay

attrs.description: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.
attrs.name: slantLabels

attrs.description: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attributes just lets you do so. It allows you to display every n(th) X-axis label.
attrs.name: labelStep

attrs.description: If you've opted for STAGGER mode as `labelDisplay`, using this attribute you can control how many lines to stagger the label to. By default, all labels are displayed in a single line.
attrs.name: staggerLines

attrs.description: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.
attrs.name: rotateValues

description: Data labels refer to the names for the data points which appear on the x-axis and data values refer to the plot values i.e., values of each data plot.

attrs.description: This parameter sets the path of the page which is supposed to relay real-time data to the chart. If you've special characters as a part of your data stream URL, like ? or &, you'll need to URL Encode the entire `dataStreamURL` This page needs to be on the same sub-domain on which the chart is hosted and invoked from.
attrs.name: dataStreamURL

attrs.description: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data. This process will happen continuously - i.e., if you specify 5 seconds here, the chart will look for new data every 5 seconds.
attrs.name: refreshInterval

attrs.description: The time after which the chart will keep clearing its contents.
attrs.name: clearChartInterval

attrs.description: If you want the chart to keep polling for new data every x seconds and queue it, you can specify that x seconds as `updateInterval`. This helps you poll at different intervals and then draw at another interval (specified as `refreshInterval`).
attrs.name: updateInterval

attrs.description: This value helps you specify the number of data items that you want as history on the chart. For example, when you set it as 50, only 50 data items (per dataset) will be displayed on the chart. As soon as the 51st data comes in, the first data will be deleted and the rest of the data will be shifted by 1 position left - the new data will come and take the last position.
attrs.name: numDisplaySets

attrs.description: Constantly changing data stamp that can be added to real time Data URL, so as to maintain a state. Please see the section Real time capabilities > Adding data stamp
attrs.name: dataStamp

attrs.description: This parameter lets you set whether you want the latest value (received from server) to be displayed on the chart or not.
attrs.name: showRealTimeValue

attrs.description: If you are showing real time values for multiple datasets on the chart, this attribute lets you define the separator character to separate each value's display.
attrs.name: realTimeValueSep

description: Using these attributes, you can configure the data streaming feature.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers? For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
attrs.name: forceDecimals

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart..
attrs.name: defaultNumberScale

attrs.description: Unit of each block of the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleUnit

attrs.description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleValue

attrs.description:
If a data value is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `numberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `“formatNumberScale”: “1”` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `“numberScaleUnit”: “K, M”`, `“numberScaleValue”: “1000, 1000”`, and `“forceNumberScale”: “1”`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
attrs.name: forceNumberScale

attrs.description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
attrs.name: scaleRecursively

attrs.description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
attrs.name: maxScaleRecursion

attrs.description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
attrs.name: scaleSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
attrs.name: decimalSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts accepts the input decimal and thousand separators from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separators.
attrs.name: inDecimalSeparator

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts accepts the input decimal and thousand separators from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separators.
attrs.name: inThousandSeparator

description: Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers will round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: Whether to use message logger for the chart?
attrs.name: useMessageLog

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the width percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart width. So, if you set it as 80, the message logger window will take up 80% of chart width.
attrs.name: messageLogWPercent

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the height percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart height.
attrs.name: messageLogHPercent

attrs.description: Whether to show the title for message logger?
attrs.name: messageLogShowTitle

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the title for message logger, you can define your custom title here. Examples are "Error log", "Server History" etc. The title displays at the top left corner of chart.
attrs.name: messageLogTitle

attrs.description: You can customize the color of the entire message log window by setting a hex value for this attribute.
attrs.name: messageLogColor

attrs.description: The messages streamed to the chart can either be displayed in the message log window or can be passed to JavaScript. This attribute lets you control whether the messages should be logged in the in-built log window.
attrs.name: messageGoesToLog

attrs.description: This attribute lets you configure whether each message streamed from the server should be passed to a local JavaScript function.
attrs.name: messageGoesToJS

attrs.description: If you've opted to pass each message to JavaScript function, this attribute lets you define the name of the function. This helps you create your custom functions to react to messages streamed from server.
attrs.name: messageJSHandler

attrs.description: Whether to pass all message envelope parameters to the custom JavaScript function.
attrs.name: messagePassAllToJS

description: FusionWidgets XT uses the concept of streaming and showing real-time messages in the chart using Message Logger. The Message logger can be effectively used to show necessary real-time information or live error logs.

attrs.description: Whether to apply the shadow effects for data plot?
attrs.name: showShadow

attrs.description: Whether the area border will show up.
attrs.name: showPlotBorder

attrs.description: Color for border
attrs.name: plotBorderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness.
attrs.name: plotBorderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha.
attrs.name: plotBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether border will appear as dashed?
attrs.name: plotBorderDashed

attrs.description: If dashed, then what will be length of dash?
attrs.name: plotBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: plotBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Area fill color.
attrs.name: plotFillColor

attrs.description: Area fill alpha.
attrs.name: plotFillAlpha

attrs.description: You can globally add a gradient color to the entire plot of chart by specifying the second color as this attribute. For example, if you've specified individual colors for your plot and now you want a gradient that ends in white. So, specify `FFFFFF` (white) as this color and the chart will now draw plots as gradient.
attrs.name: plotGradientColor

attrs.description: If you've opted to fill the plot as gradient, this attribute lets you set the fill angle for gradient.
attrs.name: plotFillAngle

description: These attributes let you configure how your plot (area) will appear on the chart.

attrs.description: Whether to draw anchors on the chart? If the anchors are not shown, then the tooltip and links won't work.
attrs.name: drawAnchors

attrs.description: This attribute sets the number of sides the anchor will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides will represent a triangle, with 4 it will be a square and so on.
attrs.name: anchorSides

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Lets you set the border color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Helps you set border thickness of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Helps you set the background color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors. If you need to hide the anchors on chart but still enable tooltips, set this as 0.
attrs.name: anchorAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

description: On line/area charts, anchors (or marker points) are polygons which appear at the joint of two consecutive lines/area points. These are indicators to show the position of data points. The anchors handle tooltips and links for the data points. So, if you opt to not render anchors on a chart, the tooltips and links won't function. You can, however, hide them by setting alpha to 0 and still enable tooltips and links. You can customize all the facets of anchors using the properties below.

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageVAlign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHAlign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image. This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description: Sets color of the x-axis of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisLineColor

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

attrs.description: Where to position the logo on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: logoPosition

attrs.description: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.
attrs.name: logoAlpha

attrs.description: You can also change the size of externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.
attrs.name: logoScale

attrs.description: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts link format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.
attrs.name: logoLink

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.
attrs.name: canvasBgColor

attrs.description: Sets alpha for Canvas Background. For gradient, enter alpha list separated by comma.
attrs.name: canvasBgAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background ratio for gradients.
attrs.name: canvasBgRatio

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background angle in case of gradient.
attrs.name: canvasBgAngle

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border color.
attrs.name: canvasBorderColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.
attrs.name: canvasBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you control transparency of canvas border.
attrs.name: canvasBorderAlpha

description: Canvas refers to the area in which the chart is plotted. The following attributes can be used to customize the canvas:

attrs.description: Number of horizontal axis division lines that you want on the chart.
attrs.name: numDivLines

attrs.description: Color for divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of divisional lines
attrs.name: divLineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineAlpha

attrs.description: Whether the divisional lines should be displayed as dashed lines instead of whole lines.
attrs.name: divLineDashed

attrs.description: If the divisional lines are to be displayed as dashed lines, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.
attrs.name: divLineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: divLineDashGap

attrs.description: Whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands?
attrs.name: showAlternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridAlpha

attrs.description: Number of vertical axis division lines
attrs.name: numVDivLines

attrs.description: Color of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineAlpha

attrs.description: Whether vertical divisional lines appear as dashed?
attrs.name: vDivLineDashed

attrs.description: If vertical div lines are dashed, this attribute lets you control the width of dash.
attrs.name: vDivLineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: vDivLineDashGap

attrs.description: Whether to show alternate vertical colored grid bands?
attrs.name: showAlternateVGridColor

attrs.description: Color of alternate vertical colored grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateVGridColor

attrs.description: Alpha of alternate vertical colored grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateVGridAlpha

description: Using this set of attributes, you can control the properties of divisional lines and alternate color bands. Divisional Lines are horizontal or vertical lines running through the canvas. Each divisional line signifies a smaller unit of the entire axis thus aiding the users in interpreting the chart. Alternate color bands are colored blocks between two successive divisional lines.

attrs.description: Color for the Zero Plane. Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at position 0 on the y-axis, when negative data is being shown on the chart.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneColor

attrs.description: Thickness of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneAlpha

attrs.description: To display the value of the zero plane set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: showZeroPlaneValue

description: The zero plane is a plane that signifies the 0 position on the chart which separates the positive and negative numbers on a chart having both of them. If there are no negative numbers on the chart, you won't see a visible zero plane. You can customize the zero plane with the following properties:

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify the `outCnvBaseFont` attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font family of the chart text which lies outside the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontColor

attrs.description: If real time value is to be displayed on the chart, this attribute lets you set the font face of the same.
attrs.name: realTimeValueFont

attrs.description: If real time value is to be displayed on the chart, this attribute lets you set the font size of the same.
attrs.name: realTimeValueFontSize

attrs.description: If real time value is to be displayed on the chart, this attribute lets you set the font color of the same.
attrs.name: realTimeValueFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like Caption, sub-caption etc.), you'll need to use the Styles feature. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc. Using Styles you can also configure real-time values.

attrs.description: Whether to show legend for the chart (only multi-series and combination charts)?
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Whether legend keys should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend item font
attrs.name: legendItemFont

attrs.description: Sets legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color
attrs.name: legendItemFontColor

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color on hover
attrs.name: legendItemHoverFontColor

attrs.description: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below (BOTTOM) the chart and to the right (RIGHT) of the chart.
attrs.name: legendPosition

attrs.description: Sets the legend caption horizontal alignment .
attrs.name: legendCaptionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether legend caption should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font
attrs.name: legendCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font size
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font color
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a legend key, the dataplots associated with that series are eliminated from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the dataplots to reappear.
attrs.name: interactiveLegend

attrs.description: Sets the color that applies on both text font and icon when they are in a  disabled / hidden state
attrs.name: legendItemHiddenColor

attrs.description: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.
attrs.name: legendCaption

attrs.description: Border Color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Background color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgColor

attrs.description: Background alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a shadow for legend?
attrs.name: legendShadow

attrs.description: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.
attrs.name: legendAllowDrag

attrs.description: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.
attrs.name: legendScrollBgColor

attrs.description: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: reverseLegend

attrs.description: Scaling of legend icon is possible starting FusionWidgets XT. This attribute lets you control the size of legend icon.
attrs.name: legendIconScale

attrs.description: If your chart contains multiple series, the legend is displayed as a grid comprising of multiple legend keys. With the help of this attribute you can specify the number of columns that are to be displayed in the legend.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
attrs.name: minimiseWrappingInLegend

attrs.description:
Specifies whether drawing a custom legend icon will be enabled. All legend icon customization attributes will work only if this feature is enabled. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
attrs.name: drawCustomLegendIcon

attrs.description:
Sets the border color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot border color
attrs.name: legendIconBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the background color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot fill color
attrs.name: legendIconBgColor

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon background transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the number of sides for the legend icon. 

Default value: 4
attrs.name: legendIconSides

attrs.description:
Sets the thickness of the legend icon border. 

Default value: 1
attrs.name: legendIconBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets the starting angle of for drawing the legend icon. 

Default value: 45
attrs.name: legendIconStartAngle

description: In multi-series charts, the series name of each data-set shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide the same. Also, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of the chart. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.

attrs.description: Whether to show tooltip on chart?
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control whether series name will show up in tooltip or not.
attrs.name: seriesNameInToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for tooltip.
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border color for tooltip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tooltip.
attrs.name: toolTipSepChar

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tooltips.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

description: These attributes let you control the tooltip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the chart canvas. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between caption and top of chart canvas. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.
attrs.name: captionPadding

attrs.description: Lets you set the space between the canvas border and first & last data points
attrs.name: canvasPadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).
attrs.name: xAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).
attrs.name: yAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesPadding

attrs.description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.
attrs.name: labelPadding

attrs.description: It sets the vertical space between the end of columns and start of value textboxes. This basically helps you control the space you want between your columns/anchors and the value textboxes.
attrs.name: valuePadding

attrs.description: Vertical distance between the real-time value and x-axis labels.
attrs.name: realTimeValuePadding

attrs.description: Padding of legend from right/bottom side of canvas.
attrs.name: legendPadding

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartLeftMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartRightMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartTopMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put at the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartBottomMargin

attrs.description: Left margin of canvas. Canvas will start from that position.
attrs.name: canvasLeftMargin

attrs.description: Right margin of canvas. Canvas will end at that position.
attrs.name: canvasRightMargin

attrs.description: Top margin of canvas.
attrs.name: canvasTopMargin

attrs.description: Bottom margin of canvas.
attrs.name: canvasBottomMargin

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionWidgets XT allows you manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. Padding in FusionWidgets XT is always defined in pixels, unless the attribute itself suggests some other scale (like `plotSpacePercent`, which configures the spacing using percentage values). You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. It's not necessary for you to specify any padding/margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.

attrs.description: Lets you specify font face for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: font

attrs.description: Lets you specify font color for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: fontColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify font size for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: fontSize

description:
The `categories` object and the `category` object (child of  the `categories` object)  are used to specify x-axis labels for real-time charts.

The attributes of the `categories` object are used to set the font properties of all x-axis labels collectively.

attrs.description: This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.
attrs.name: label

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showLabel

attrs.description: The tooltip defined in the `category` object appears only when the mouse cursor is hovered over the data plots. However, this will not appear when the cursor is moved over the data labels (except for a situation when long labels are automatically truncated with ellipses. In this situation, if the mouse cursor is hovered over a truncated label, the tooltip will appear with the full label). In case you want to set a short label and show the full label in tooltip, define the full label using this attribute within the `category` object. The tooltip with the full label will appear only when the mouse is hovered on the dataplot.
attrs.name: tooltext

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: font

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: fontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size.
attrs.name: fontSize

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be bold or not.
attrs.name: fontBold

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be italicized or not.
attrs.name: fontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
attrs.name: borderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
attrs.name: borderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Whether the x-axis label border should be rendered using dashed lines?
attrs.name: borderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash line.
attrs.name: borderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashed lines.
attrs.name: borderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets the link for each individual x-axis label.
attrs.name: link

description: The attributes of the `category` object are used to define and customize individual x-axis labels for real-time charts.

attrs.description: Set this attribute to __true__ to render a vertical data separator line.
attrs.name: vLine

attrs.description: Display label for the vLine.
attrs.name: label

attrs.description: This attribute defines the color of vertical separator line
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Thickness in pixels of the vertical separator line.
attrs.name: thickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the vertical separator line.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Whether the vertical separator line should appear as dashed?
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: If the vertical separator line is to appear as dashed, this attribute defines the length of dash.
attrs.name: dashLen

attrs.description: If the vertical separator line is to appear as dashed, this attribute defines the length of dash gap.
attrs.name: dashGap

attrs.description: This attribute sets the alpha (transparency) of the entire dataset.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors of the particular dataset. If you need to hide the anchors for the dataset but still enable tool tips, set this as 0.
attrs.name: anchorAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you set the background color of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Lets you set the border color of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Helps you set border thickness of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Sets the number of sides that the anchors of the particular dataset will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides will represent a triangle, with 4 it will be a square and so on.
attrs.name: anchorSides

attrs.description: Whether to run the values of this dataset through alert manager, each time an update is received?
attrs.name: checkForAlerts

attrs.description: This attribute sets the color using which columns, lines, area of that dataset will be drawn. For column chart, you can specify a list of comma separated hex codes to get a gradient plot
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Whether this dataset will appear as dashed?
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: Whether to draw anchors for the particular dataset? If the anchors are not shown, then the tooltip and links won't work for the dataset.
attrs.name: drawAnchors

attrs.description: Whether to include the `seriesName` of this dataset in legend? This can be particularly useful when you're using combination charts and you've used the area/line chart to plot a trend and you do not want the `seriesName` of that trend to appear in legend.
attrs.name: includeInLegend

attrs.description: Alpha for data plot border of this dataset
attrs.name: plotBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Color for data plot border of this dataset
attrs.name: plotBorderColor

attrs.description: Thickness for data plot border of this dataset
attrs.name: plotBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you specify the series name for a particular dataset. For example, if you're plotting a chart to indicate monthly sales analysis for 2005 and 2006, the `seriesName` for the first dataset will be 2005 and that of the second will be 2006. The `seriesName` of a dataset is shown in legend.
attrs.name: seriesName

attrs.description: Whether to show the border of this dataset?
attrs.name: showPlotBorder

attrs.description: Whether to show the values for this dataset?
attrs.name: showValues

description: In real-time charts, attributes of the `dataset` object are used to define the properties for all data series to be plotted on the chart.

attrs.description: For multi-series charts, you can define the alpha of datasets at dataset level. However, if you wish to highlight a particular data element, you can specify its alpha at "set" level using this attribute.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific alpha of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorAlpha

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific alpha of the anchor background.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific background color of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific border color of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific border thickness of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific radius (in pixels) of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Lets you specify "set" specific sides of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorSides

attrs.description: For multi-series charts, you can define the color of datasets at dataset level. However, if you wish to highlight a particular data element, you can specify it's color at "set" level using this attribute.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Whether the border of this data item should appear as dashed? This is particularly useful when you want to highlight a data (such as forecast or trend etc.). This value over-rides the dataset level value.
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: You can define links for individual data items. That enables the end user to click on data items (columns, lines, bars, etc.) and drill-down to other pages. To define the link for data items, use the `link` attribute. You can define links that open in same window, new window, pop-up window or frames. Please see Drill-Down Charts section for more information. Also, you'll need to URL Encode all the special characters (like ? and &) present in the link.
attrs.name: link

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show/hide values of individual data items using this attribute. This value over-rides the dataset level value.
attrs.name: showValue

attrs.description: By default, FusionWidgets XT shows the "`label`, `value`" as tooltip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tooltip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.
attrs.name: toolText

attrs.description: Numerical value for the data item. This value will be plotted on the chart.
attrs.name: value

attrs.description: Alpha of the trend line.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Color of the trend line and its associated text
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash gap.
attrs.name: dashGap

attrs.description: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.
attrs.name: dashLen

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define whether the trend line will appear as dashed?
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example: `displayValue='Last Month High'`. When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of `startValue`.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: The ending y-axis value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `endValue` will be 109. If you do not specify a value for `endValue`, it will automatically assume the same value as `startValue`.
attrs.name: endValue

attrs.description: Whether the trend will be displayed as a line or a zone (fill-colored rectangle).
attrs.name: isTrendZone

attrs.description: Whether the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them?
attrs.name: showOnTop

attrs.description: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `startValue` will be 102.
attrs.name: startValue

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.
attrs.name: thickness

attrs.description: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart? This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with divisional lines values on the chart.
attrs.name: valueOnRight

description:
Trend-lines are horizontal lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. The `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object is used to add trend-lines to a chart.

Although the `line` object has to be defined within the `trendlines` object, the latter cannot be used to collectively customize trend-lines, because it does not have any attributes of its own.

The attributes of the `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object, are used to create and customize trend-lines for charts.

attrs.description: Sets the font family for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFont

attrs.description: Sets the font size for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFontSize

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be bold formatted. 

Default value: 0 (not bold formatted)
attrs.name: trendValueFontBold

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be italicized. 

Default value: 0 (not italicized)
attrs.name: trendValueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the background of the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the border around the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets padding for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the radius for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the thickness for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets whether the border around the trend-line display value will be drawn as a dashed line. 

Default value: 0 (drawn as a straight line)
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash, if the border around the trend-line display value is drawn as a dashed line.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between each dash, if the border around the trend-line display value is drawn as a dashed line.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashGap

description:
These attributes let you customize the text displayed with a trend-line. 

__Note__: These attributes belong to the `chart` object and  not to the `line` object (child of the `trendline` object). They are, therefore, applied to all trend-lines on your chart.
